identificationModule.briefTitle: Neurological Complications at Stroke Patients With Diabetes Mellitus
identificationModule.officialTitle: Neurological Complications at Stroke Patients With Diabetes Mellitus During the First Six Months After a Cerebral Ischemia

descriptionModule.briefSummary: It is to be investigated if a correlation exist between the development of the HbA1c value and the complication rate is following a stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The immediate objective of the study is to find out if a correlation between blood sugar control in diabetics and the incidence of complications after a stroke exists.

The study has a high practical importance because any consequences in the treatment of diabetes mellitus can be implemented without affecting costs.

armGroups.label: HbA1c ≤ 7
armGroups.description: Stroke patients with mild diabetes mellitus HbA1c ≤ 7

armGroups.label: HbA1c ≥ 7,5
armGroups.description: Stroke patients with severe diabetes mellitus HbA1c ≥ 7,5

primaryOutcomes.measure: Functional outcome six months after the cerebral ischemia
primaryOutcomes.description: Functional outcome for the National Institutes of Health Stroke scale, the Barthel Index and Modified Ranking Scala six months after the cerebral ischemia.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Additional cerebral ischemia six months after the first cerebral ischemia
Mortality in the first 6 months after the primary cerebral ischemia

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Stroke patients on the Stroke Unit with hyperglycemia with cerebral ischemia within the last 24 hours

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with intracerebral hemorrhage
* Pregnant patients
* Patients with sensory aphasia
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Stroke patients on the Stroke Unit with hyperglycemia with cerebral ischemia within the last 24 hours
